trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Databases
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Databases

trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Databases
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Databases

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the operations that can be executed on a DocumentDB database.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the operations that can be executed on a DocumentDB database.

trans-unit.source: Each DocumentDB account supports multiple independent named databases.
trans-unit.target: Each DocumentDB account supports multiple independent named databases.

trans-unit.source: A database is a logical container of document storage, partitioned across collections.
trans-unit.target: A database is a logical container of document storage, partitioned across collections.

trans-unit.source: A database is also a container of users.
trans-unit.target: A database is also a container of users.

trans-unit.source: It is a system resource and thus contains a fixed schema representing the construct of a database.
trans-unit.target: It is a system resource and thus contains a fixed schema representing the construct of a database.

trans-unit.source: The database resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>dbs</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The database resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>dbs</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of the URI: <fictitiousUri>https://mydbaccount.documents.azure.com/dbs.</fictitiousUri>
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of the URI: <fictitiousUri>https://mydbaccount.documents.azure.com/dbs.</fictitiousUri>

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a database:
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a database:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is the only <externalLink><linkText>user settable property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This is the only <externalLink><linkText>user settable property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: It is a unique name that identifies the database, i.e. no two databases will share the same name in an account.
trans-unit.target: It is a unique name that identifies the database, i.e. no two databases will share the same name in an account.

trans-unit.source: The name must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The name must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a <externalLink><linkText>system generated property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This is a <externalLink><linkText>system generated property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the database.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the database.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: _colls
trans-unit.target: _colls

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the <embeddedLabel>collections</embeddedLabel> resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the <embeddedLabel>collections</embeddedLabel> resource.

trans-unit.source: _users
trans-unit.target: _users

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the <embeddedLabel>users</embeddedLabel> resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the <embeddedLabel>users</embeddedLabel> resource.
